intro: Oenothera venusta, commonly known as the showy evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking, showy yellow flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually upright and branching. Oenothera venusta is a member of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
